Nodegrue NodeJS Module

This module wraps MakerBot geometry (libthing) and toolpathing (MiracleGrue)
functionality in a standard NodeJS module.  Core functionality is provided via
a compiled binary addon built separately.

To force nodegrue to build:

    ../../build-repos.py --this-dir --cmake-configure-args="-DBUILD_NODEGRUE=ON" --cmake-force-reconfigure
    
After running this once, you should then be able to have nodegrue rebuild with just `../../build-repos.py --this-dir` until I guess cmake arbitrarily decides it won't anymore(?)

To use:

    const nodegrue = require('nodegrue')
    console.log(nodegrue.getVersion())


## Toolpather API
    const toolpather = new nodegrue.NodeToolpather();
---
### runMiracleGrue
Do a full slice using the given model and config, outputting to any combination of gcode | jsontoolpath | metadata, optionally reporting progress
#### Parameters
* **config_path** (string) - path to a config file with which to slice with
* **input_filepath** (string) - path to a model to be sliced (.stl | .obj | .thing| .ply)
* **progress_callback** (function) (optional) - handler for progress reported by Miracle-Grue; callback is called with a single string param 
* **json_output_filepath** (string) (optional) - path to which slice result will be output in jsontoolpath format
* **metadata_filepath** (string) (optional) - path to which metadata from slice will be output
* **gcode_filepath** (string) (optional) - path to which slice result will be output in gcode format
#### Return
(object)
* **sliceCompletionPromise** (node promise) - promise that will resolve when slice completes, or throw an Exception with the message 'Cancelled' if cancelled
* **cancelFunc** (function) - function with which to cancel the slice
---
### createBasicSlice
Create a basic slice using the given model and config, outputting a NodeChunkStack object
#### Parameters
* **config_path** (string) - path to a config file with which to slice with
* **input_filepath** (string) - path to a model to be sliced (.stl | .obj | .thing | .ply)
#### Return
(object)
* **chunkStackPromise** (node promise) - promise that will resolve when slice completes with a NodeChunkStack object, or throw an Exception with the message 'Cancelled' if cancelled
* **cancelFunc** (function) - function with which to cancel the slice
---
### createRegionedSlice
Create a regioned slice using the given model and config, outputting a NodeChunkStack object
#### Parameters
* **config_path** (string) - path to a config file with which to slice with
* **input_filepath** (string) - path to a model to be sliced (.stl | .obj | .thing | .ply)
#### Return
(object)
* **chunkStackPromise** (node promise) - promise that will resolve when slice completes with a NodeChunkStack object, or throw an Exception with the message 'Cancelled' if cancelled
* **cancelFunc** (function) - function with which to cancel the slice
---
### createFilledSlice
Create a filled slice using the given model and config, outputting a NodeChunkStack object
#### Parameters
* **config_path** (string) - path to a config file with which to slice with
* **input_filepath** (string) - path to a model to be sliced (.stl | .obj | .thing | .ply)
#### Return
(object)
* **chunkStackPromise** (node promise) - promise that will resolve when slice completes with a NodeChunkStack object, or throw an Exception with the message 'Cancelled' if cancelled
* **cancelFunc** (function) - function with which to cancel the slice


## NodeChunkStack
Object type produced by `create*Slice` functions

---
### getMinX
Get min X coordinate of the chunk stack
#### Return
* (number) - min x coordinate of chunk stack
---
### getMaxX
Get max X coordinate of the chunk stack
#### Return
* (number) - max x coordinate of chunk stack
---
### getMinX
Get min X coordinate of the chunk stack
#### Return
* (number) - min X coordinate of chunk stack
---
### getMaxX
Get max X coordinate of the chunk stack
#### Return
* (number) - max X coordinate of chunk stack
---
### getMinY
Get min Y coordinate of the chunk stack
#### Return
* (number) - min Y coordinate of chunk stack
---
### getMaxY
Get max Y coordinate of the chunk stack
#### Return
* (number) - max Y coordinate of chunk stack
---
### getLowerZ
Get lower z bounds of the chunk stack
#### Return
* (number) - lower z bounds of chunk stack
---
### getUpperZ
Get upper z bounds of the chunk stack
#### Return
* (number) - upper z bounds of chunk stack
---
### getAllChunks
Get all the chunks that make up the chunk stack
#### Return
* (array) - array of NodeChunk objects that make up the chunk stack

## NodeChunk
Object that makes up NodeChunkStacks

---
### getRegion
Get the region for the chunk
#### Return
* (array) - array of loops, which are an array of points (length-2 array of Numbers giving an x and y coordinate), describing the region
---
### getPosition
Get the position of the chunk
#### Return
(object)
* **lower_z** (number) - lower z position of the chunk
* **upper_z** (number) - upper z position of the chunk
* **nozzle_offset** (number) - nozzle offset for the chunk
